UNCLASSIFIED

Windows Server 2019 Security Technical Implementation Guide

Version 1 Release 5

17 Jun 2020

  • Introduction
    • Executive Summary
    • Authority
    • Vulnerability Severity Category Code Definitions
    • STIG Distribution

    • Other Considerations

    • Table of Requirements

  • Revision History

Introduction

Executive Summary

The Windows Server 2019 Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of the Department of Defense (DoD) information systems.

Authority

DoD Instruction (DoDI) 8500.01 requires that “all IT that receives, processes, stores, displays, or transmits DoD information will be […] configured […] consistent with applicable DoD cybersecurity policies, standards, and architectures” and tasks that Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) “develops and maintains control correlation identifiers (CCIs), security requirements guides (SRGs), security technical implementation guides (STIGs), and mobile code risk categories and usage guides that implement and are consistent with DoD cybersecurity policies, standards, architectures, security controls, and validation procedures, with the support of the NSA/CSS, using input from stakeholders, and using automation whenever possible.” This document is provided under the authority of DoDI 8500.01.

Although the use of the principles and guidelines in these SRGs/STIGs provides an environment that contributes to the security requirements of DoD systems, applicable NIST SP 800-53 cybersecurity controls need to be applied to all systems and architectures based on the Committee on National Security Systems (CNSS) Instruction (CNSSI) 1253.

Vulnerability Severity Category Code Definitions

Severity Category Codes (referred to as CAT) are a measure of vulnerabilities used to assess a facility or system security posture. Each security policy specified in this document is assigned a Severity Code of CAT I, II, or III.

Category Code Guidelines
CAT I Any vulnerability, the exploitation of which will, directly and immediately result in loss of Confidentiality, Availability, or Integrity.
CAT II Any vulnerability, the exploitation of which has a potential to result in loss of Confidentiality, Availability, or Integrity.
CAT III Any vulnerability, the existence of which degrades measures to protect against loss of Confidentiality, Availability, or Integrity.

STIG Distribution

Parties within the DoD and Federal Government’s computing environments can obtain the applicable STIG from the Cyber Exchange website at https://cyber.mil/. This site contains the latest copies of STIGs, SRGs, and other related security information. Those without a Common Access Card (CAC) that has DoD Certificates can obtain the STIG from https://public.cyber.mil/.

SRG Compliance Reporting

All technical NIST SP 800-53 requirements were considered while developing this STIG. Requirements that are applicable and configurable will be included in the final STIG. A report marked For Official Use Only (FOUO) will be available for those items that did not meet requirements. This report will be available to component Authorizing Official (AO) personnel for risk assessment purposes by request via email to: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.

Document Revision Process

Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil. DISA will coordinate all change requests with the relevant DoD organizations before inclusion in this document. Approved changes will be made in accordance with the DISA maintenance release schedule.

Other Considerations

DISA accepts no liability for the consequences of applying specific configuration settings made on the basis of the SRGs/STIGs. It must be noted that the configuration settings specified should be evaluated in a local, representative test environment before implementation in a production environment, especially within large user populations. The extensive variety of environments makes it impossible to test these configuration settings for all potential software configurations.

For some production environments, failure to test before implementation may lead to a loss of required functionality. Evaluating the risks and benefits to a system’s particular circumstances and requirements is the system owner’s responsibility. The evaluated risks resulting from not applying specified configuration settings must be approved by the responsible Authorizing Official. Furthermore, DISA implies no warranty that the application of all specified configurations will make a system 100 percent secure.

Security guidance is provided for the Department of Defense. While other agencies and organizations are free to use it, care must be given to ensure that all applicable security guidance is applied both at the device hardening level as well as the architectural level due to the fact that some of the settings may not be able to be configured in environments outside the DoD architecture.

Product Approval Disclaimer

The existence of a STIG does not equate to DoD approval for the procurement or use of a product.

STIGs provide configurable operational security guidance for products being used by the DoD. STIGs, along with vendor confidential documentation, also provide a basis for assessing compliance with Cybersecurity controls/control enhancements, which supports system Assessment and Authorization (A&A) under the DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF). DoD Authorizing Officials (AOs) may request available vendor confidential documentation for a product that has a STIG for product evaluation and RMF purposes from disa.stig_spt@mail.mil. This documentation is not published for general access to protect the vendor’s proprietary information.

AOs have the purview to determine product use/approval IAW DoD policy and through RMF risk acceptance. Inputs into acquisition or pre-acquisition product selection include such processes as:

  • National Information Assurance Partnership (NIAP) evaluation for National Security Systems (NSS) (http://www.niap-ccevs.org/) IAW CNSSP #11
  • National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) (http://csrc.nist.gov/groups/STM/cmvp/) IAW Federal/DoD mandated standards
  • DoD Unified Capabilities (UC) Approved Products List (APL) (http://www.disa.mil/network-services/ucco) IAW DoDI 8100.04

Requirements Catalog

Table of Requirements
STIG ID Group ID Rule ID Requirement Severity
WN19-00-000010 V-93369 SV-103457r1_rule Windows Server 2019 users with Administrative privileges must have separate accounts for administrative duties and normal operational tasks. CAT I
WN19-00-000020 V-93473 SV-103559r1_rule Windows Server 2019 passwords for the built-in Administrator account must be changed at least every 60 days. CAT II
WN19-00-000030 V-93205 SV-103293r1_rule Windows Server 2019 administrative accounts must not be used with applications that access the Internet, such as web browsers, or with potential Internet sources, such as email. CAT I
WN19-00-000040 V-93207 SV-103295r1_rule Windows Server 2019 members of the Backup Operators group must have separate accounts for backup duties and normal operational tasks. CAT II
WN19-00-000050 V-93461 SV-103547r1_rule Windows Server 2019 manually managed application account passwords must be at least 15 characters in length. CAT II
WN19-00-000060 V-93209 SV-103297r1_rule Windows Server 2019 manually managed application account passwords must be changed at least annually or when a system administrator with knowledge of the password leaves the organization. CAT II
WN19-00-000070 V-93437 SV-103523r1_rule Windows Server 2019 shared user accounts must not be permitted. CAT II
WN19-00-000080 V-93379 SV-103465r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs. CAT II
WN19-00-000090 V-93213 SV-103301r1_rule Windows Server 2019 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled and ready for use. CAT II
WN19-00-000100 V-93215 SV-103303r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must be maintained at a supported servicing level. CAT I
WN19-00-000110 V-93217 SV-103305r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must use an anti-virus program. CAT I
WN19-00-000120 V-93219 SV-103307r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have a host-based intrusion detection or prevention system. CAT II
WN19-00-000130 V-92991 SV-103079r1_rule Windows Server 2019 local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes. CAT I
WN19-00-000140 V-93019 SV-103107r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions for the system drive root directory (usually C:\) must conform to minimum requirements. CAT II
WN19-00-000150 V-93021 SV-103109r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions for program file directories must conform to minimum requirements. CAT II
WN19-00-000160 V-93023 SV-103111r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions for the Windows installation directory must conform to minimum requirements. CAT II
WN19-00-000170 V-93025 SV-103113r1_rule Windows Server 2019 default permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE registry hive must be maintained. CAT II
WN19-00-000180 V-92993 SV-103081r1_rule Windows Server 2019 non-administrative accounts or groups must only have print permissions on printer shares. CAT III
WN19-00-000190 V-93457 SV-103543r1_rule Windows Server 2019 outdated or unused accounts must be removed or disabled. CAT II
WN19-00-000200 V-93439 SV-103525r2_rule Windows Server 2019 accounts must require passwords. CAT II
WN19-00-000210 V-93475 SV-103561r1_rule Windows Server 2019 passwords must be configured to expire. CAT II
WN19-00-000220 V-93203 SV-103291r1_rule Windows Server 2019 system files must be monitored for unauthorized changes. CAT II
WN19-00-000230 V-93531 SV-103617r1_rule Windows Server 2019 non-system-created file shares must limit access to groups that require it. CAT II
WN19-00-000240 V-93221 SV-103309r2_rule Windows Server 2019 must have software certificate installation files removed. CAT II
WN19-00-000250 V-93515 SV-103601r1_rule Windows Server 2019 systems requiring data at rest protections must employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of the information at rest. CAT II
WN19-00-000260 V-93543 SV-103629r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must implement protection methods such as TLS, encrypted VPNs, or IPsec if the data owner has a strict requirement for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality is maintained at every step of the data transfer and handling process. CAT II
WN19-00-000270 V-93381 SV-103467r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have the roles and features required by the system documented. CAT II
WN19-00-000280 V-93571 SV-103657r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have a host-based firewall installed and enabled. CAT II
WN19-00-000290 V-93567 SV-103653r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where Host Based Security System (HBSS) is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by HBSS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP). CAT II
WN19-00-000300 V-92975 SV-103063r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must automatically remove or disable temporary user accounts after 72 hours. CAT II
WN19-00-000310 V-92977 SV-103065r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must automatically remove or disable emergency accounts after the crisis is resolved or within 72 hours. CAT II
WN19-00-000320 V-93383 SV-103469r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have the Fax Server role installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000330 V-93421 SV-103507r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have the Microsoft FTP service installed unless required by the organization. CAT II
WN19-00-000340 V-93385 SV-103471r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have the Peer Name Resolution Protocol installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000350 V-93387 SV-103473r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have Simple TCP/IP Services installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000360 V-93423 SV-103509r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have the Telnet Client installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000370 V-93389 SV-103475r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have the TFTP Client installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000380 V-93391 SV-103477r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000390 V-93393 SV-103479r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB server. CAT II
WN19-00-000400 V-93395 SV-103481r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have the Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol disabled on the SMB client. CAT II
WN19-00-000410 V-93397 SV-103483r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not have Windows PowerShell 2.0 installed. CAT II
WN19-00-000420 V-93223 SV-103311r1_rule Windows Server 2019 FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons. CAT II
WN19-00-000430 V-93225 SV-103313r1_rule Windows Server 2019 FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. CAT II
WN19-00-000440 V-93187 SV-103275r1_rule The Windows Server 2019 time service must synchronize with an appropriate DoD time source. CAT III
WN19-00-000450 V-93227 SV-103315r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) removed from user rights. CAT II
WN19-00-000460 V-93229 SV-103317r1_rule Windows Server 2019 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS. CAT III
WN19-00-000470 V-93231 SV-103319r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have Secure Boot enabled. CAT III
WN19-AC-000010 V-93145 SV-103233r1_rule Windows Server 2019 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater. CAT II
WN19-AC-000020 V-93141 SV-103229r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have the number of allowed bad logon attempts configured to three or less. CAT II
WN19-AC-000030 V-93143 SV-103231r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset configured to 15 minutes or greater. CAT II
WN19-AC-000040 V-93479 SV-103565r1_rule Windows Server 2019 password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered. CAT II
WN19-AC-000050 V-93477 SV-103563r1_rule Windows Server 2019 maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less. CAT II
WN19-AC-000060 V-93471 SV-103557r1_rule Windows Server 2019 minimum password age must be configured to at least one day. CAT II
WN19-AC-000070 V-93463 SV-103549r1_rule Windows Server 2019 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters. CAT II
WN19-AC-000080 V-93459 SV-103545r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have the built-in Windows password complexity policy enabled. CAT II
WN19-AC-000090 V-93465 SV-103551r1_rule Windows Server 2019 reversible password encryption must be disabled. CAT I
WN19-AU-000010 V-93183 SV-103271r1_rule Windows Server 2019 audit records must be backed up to a different system or media than the system being audited. CAT II
WN19-AU-000020 V-93185 SV-103273r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must, at a minimum, off-load audit records of interconnected systems in real time and off-load standalone systems weekly. CAT II
WN19-AU-000030 V-93189 SV-103277r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts. CAT II
WN19-AU-000040 V-93191 SV-103279r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts. CAT II
WN19-AU-000050 V-93193 SV-103281r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts. CAT II

WN19-CC-000010 V-93399 SV-103485r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must prevent the display of slide shows on the lock screen. CAT II
WN19-CC-000020 V-93401 SV-103487r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must have WDigest Authentication disabled. CAT II
WN19-CC-000030 V-93233 SV-103321r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent IP source routing. CAT III
WN19-CC-000040 V-93235 SV-103323r1_rule Windows Server 2019 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent Internet Protocol (IP) source routing. CAT III
WN19-CC-000050 V-93237 SV-103325r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)-generated routes. CAT III
WN19-CC-000060 V-93541 SV-103627r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers. CAT III
WN19-CC-000070 V-93239 SV-103327r1_rule Windows Server 2019 insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled. CAT II
WN19-CC-000080 V-93241 SV-103329r1_rule Windows Server 2019 hardened Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares. CAT II
WN19-CC-000090 V-93173 SV-103261r1_rule Windows Server 2019 command line data must be included in process creation events. CAT II
WN19-CC-000100 V-93243 SV-103331r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must be configured to enable Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials. CAT II
WN19-CC-000110 V-93245 SV-103333r1_rule Windows Server 2019 virtualization-based security must be enabled with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection. CAT II
WN19-CC-000130 V-93249 SV-103337r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified as bad. CAT II
WN19-CC-000140 V-93251 SV-103339r1_rule Windows Server 2019 group policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed. CAT II
WN19-CC-000150 V-93403 SV-103489r1_rule Windows Server 2019 downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be turned off. CAT II
WN19-CC-000160 V-93405 SV-103491r1_rule Windows Server 2019 printing over HTTP must be turned off. CAT II
WN19-CC-000170 V-93407 SV-103493r1_rule Windows Server 2019 network selection user interface (UI) must not be displayed on the logon screen. CAT II
WN19-CC-000180 V-93253 SV-103341r1_rule Windows Server 2019 users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (on battery). CAT II
WN19-CC-000190 V-93255 SV-103343r1_rule Windows Server 2019 users must be prompted to authenticate when the system wakes from sleep (plugged in). CAT II
WN19-CC-000200 V-93409 SV-103495r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft. CAT III
WN19-CC-000210 V-93373 SV-103459r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices. CAT I
WN19-CC-000220 V-93375 SV-103461r1_rule Windows Server 2019 default AutoRun behavior must be configured to prevent AutoRun commands. CAT I
WN19-CC-000230 V-93377 SV-103463r1_rule Windows Server 2019 AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives. CAT I
WN19-CC-000240 V-93517 SV-103603r1_rule Windows Server 2019 administrator accounts must not be enumerated during elevation. CAT II
WN19-CC-000250 V-93257 SV-103345r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Telemetry must be configured to Security or Basic. CAT II
WN19-CC-000260 V-93259 SV-103347r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Update must not obtain updates from other PCs on the Internet. CAT III
WN19-CC-000270 V-93177 SV-103265r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater. CAT II
WN19-CC-000280 V-93179 SV-103267r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Security event log size must be configured to 196608 KB or greater. CAT II
WN19-CC-000290 V-93181 SV-103269r1_rule Windows Server 2019 System event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater. CAT II

WN19-CC-000330 V-93263 SV-103351r1_rule Windows Server 2019 File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode. CAT II
WN19-CC-000340 V-93425 SV-103511r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must not save passwords in the Remote Desktop Client. CAT II

WN19-CC-000380 V-92973 SV-103061r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to High Level. CAT II
WN19-CC-000390 V-93265 SV-103353r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must prevent attachments from being downloaded from RSS feeds. CAT II

WN19-CC-000410 V-93415 SV-103501r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must prevent Indexing of encrypted files. CAT II
WN19-CC-000420 V-93199 SV-103287r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must prevent users from changing installation options. CAT II

WN19-CC-000450 V-93269 SV-103357r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must disable automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart. CAT II
WN19-CC-000451 V-102625 SV-111575r1_rule The Windows Explorer Preview pane must be disabled for Windows Server 2019. CAT II
WN19-CC-000460 V-93175 SV-103263r2_rule Windows Server 2019 PowerShell script block logging must be enabled. CAT II
WN19-CC-000470 V-93503 SV-103589r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication. CAT I
WN19-CC-000480 V-93499 SV-103585r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not allow unencrypted traffic. CAT II
WN19-CC-000490 V-93505 SV-103591r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication. CAT II
WN19-CC-000500 V-93507 SV-103593r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication. CAT I
WN19-CC-000510 V-93501 SV-103587r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not allow unencrypted traffic. CAT II
WN19-CC-000520 V-93429 SV-103515r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not store RunAs credentials. CAT II
WN19-DC-000010 V-93027 SV-103115r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must only allow administrators responsible for the domain controller to have Administrator rights on the system. CAT I
WN19-DC-000020 V-93443 SV-103529r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Kerberos user logon restrictions must be enforced. CAT II
WN19-DC-000030 V-93445 SV-103531r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Kerberos service ticket maximum lifetime must be limited to 600 minutes or less. CAT II
WN19-DC-000040 V-93447 SV-103533r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Kerberos user ticket lifetime must be limited to 10 hours or less. CAT II
WN19-DC-000050 V-93449 SV-103535r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Kerberos policy user ticket renewal maximum lifetime must be limited to seven days or less. CAT II
WN19-DC-000060 V-93451 SV-103537r1_rule Windows Server 2019 computer clock synchronization tolerance must be limited to five minutes or less. CAT II
WN19-DC-000070 V-93029 SV-103117r1_rule Windows Server 2019 permissions on the Active Directory data files must only allow System and Administrators access. CAT I
WN19-DC-000080 V-93031 SV-103119r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory SYSVOL directory must have the proper access control permissions. CAT I
WN19-DC-000090 V-93033 SV-103121r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory Group Policy objects must have proper access control permissions. CAT I
WN19-DC-000100 V-93035 SV-103123r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must have the proper access control permissions. CAT I
WN19-DC-000110 V-93037 SV-103125r1_rule Windows Server 2019 organization created Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU) objects must have proper access control permissions. CAT I
WN19-DC-000120 V-93535 SV-103621r1_rule Windows Server 2019 data files owned by users must be on a different logical partition from the directory server data files. CAT II
WN19-DC-000130 V-93417 SV-103503r1_rule Windows Server 2019 domain controllers must run on a machine dedicated to that function. CAT II
WN19-DC-000140 V-93513 SV-103599r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must use separate, NSA-approved (Type 1) cryptography to protect the directory data in transit for directory service implementations at a classified confidentiality level when replication data traverses a network cleared to a lower level than the data. CAT II
WN19-DC-000150 V-93271 SV-103359r1_rule Windows Server 2019 directory data (outside the root DSE) of a non-public directory must be configured to prevent anonymous access. CAT I
WN19-DC-000160 V-93509 SV-103595r1_rule Windows Server 2019 directory service must be configured to terminate LDAP-based network connections to the directory server after five minutes of inactivity. CAT III

WN19-DC-000180 V-93123 SV-103211r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory Domain object must be configured with proper audit settings. CAT II
WN19-DC-000190 V-93125 SV-103213r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory Infrastructure object must be configured with proper audit settings. CAT II
WN19-DC-000200 V-93127 SV-103215r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must be configured with proper audit settings. CAT II
WN19-DC-000210 V-93129 SV-103217r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory AdminSDHolder object must be configured with proper audit settings. CAT II
WN19-DC-000220 V-93131 SV-103219r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Active Directory RID Manager$ object must be configured with proper audit settings. CAT II
WN19-DC-000230 V-92985 SV-103073r1_rule Windows Server 2019 must be configured to audit Account Management - Computer Account Management successes. CAT II

WN19-UR-000210 V-93085 SV-103173r1_rule Windows Server 2019 Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. CAT II
